alert.note: Alert for Parker Valley (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Phoenix (Central Arizona and California Desert)
info.headline: Wind Advisory issued November 15 at 12:43AM MST until November 16 at 5:00PM MST by NWS Phoenix
info.description: ...WIND ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 7 PM MST /6 PM PST/ THIS EVENING TO 5 PM MST /4 PM PST/ WEDNESDAY... * WHAT...North winds 15 to 25 mph with gusts up to 40 mph expected. Localized channels of blowing dust expected. * WHERE...In Arizona, Parker Valley. In California, Palo Verde Valley and Chuckwalla Valley. * WHEN...From 7 PM MST /6 PM PST/ this evening to 5 PM MST /4 PM PST/ Wednesday. * IMPACTS...Difficult driving conditions, especially for larger vehicles traveling along roads with crosswinds, such as I-10. Light, unsecured objects may become airborne. Blowing dust may reduce visibilities.
info.instruction: A Wind Advisory means that sustained wind speeds of between 30 and 40 mph are expected, or wind gusts of between 40 and 58 mph. Winds this strong can make driving difficult, especially for high profile vehicles. In addition, strong winds over desert areas could result in briefly lowered visibilities to well under a mile at times in blowing dust or blowing sand. Use extra caution.
